Warfarin.action: Hold the next warfarin dose, monitor INR, and seek urgent clinical guidance.

Aspirin.action: Hold aspirin for 24 hours and observe for bleeding.

Metoprolol.action: Monitor for bradycardia; no dose adjustment typically needed.

Simvastatin.action: Advise hydration and routine symptom watch.

Rosuvastatin.action: Consider lower starting dose of rosuvastatin and monitor for increased adverse effects.

Aspirin.action: If combined with serotonergic agents, hold aspirin for one cycle and contact cardiology.

Rosuvastatin.action: Increase INR monitoring frequency when initiating rosuvastatin; adjust warfarin dose if needed.

Bupropion.action: Potential CNS depression with Xywav plus bupropion; escalate to clinician before proceeding.

Zolpidem.action: Advise spacing doses and monitor for respiratory depression.
No significant interaction expected; observe for insomnia or agitation.

Atorvastatin.action: No clinically significant interaction. Continue statin therapy as prescribed.

Metoprolol.action: Monitor for hypotension and bradycardia during anesthesia. Anesthesiologist will adjust dosing.

Aspirin.action: Hold aspirin 5-7 days before surgery per surgical team recommendation to reduce bleeding risk.

Metformin.action: Hold metformin on day of surgery. Resume when eating normally post-operatively.
